About.paragraph: Our vision is to create an inclusive community of equity for the contribution to peace and sustainable development through the promotion of access to education for street children; the socio-economic empowerment of street children; and the strengthening of social cohesion and patriotism

Services.text: Promote child protection and ensure respects of the Rights.
Empower women, build resilient families, and promote healthy environment favorable for child wellbeing.
Patriotism: We are committed to contribute to the national objectives to leave no one one behind.
Love & Compassion: Our love is expressed through sacrifice, kindness and empathy.
Purpose: We focus on the bright future.

Features.text: Give Food to the Hungry : We provide food, clothing and shelter to homeless children who have been victims of floods that occurred around Lake Tanganyika in the past years and have never been set up into safe lands. One of the current priorities for the foundation is to provide basic needs to these kids; that is a safe place to live, food, and clothing.

Health and Hygiene Program : Access to health care is one of the fundamental rights. As the foundation supports homeless children, health is an important aspect that can’t be left behind. Children need psychological advice for mental health as well as medical care for a healthy body.

SDG4, Right to Education : This Program is dedicated to academic education and vocational training for homeless children and the youth. Key activities include: Enroll children in schools, provide school fee and school materials to enrolled children and follow up students’ performance and provide opportunities for capacity building etc.

Law & Social protection Program : Homeless children need support to access administrative services. For example birth certificate is a condition to access other rights such as free health care for children under five years, access to free education at the fundamental level, and application for identity card & passport.
